LJCTable.remarks: Contains methods for utilizing an HTML Table and associated context menu including data paging.

GetSelectedTable.summary: Gets the selected table if the supplied element is a table cell and the table has the supplied ID.
GetSelectedTable.returns: true if a cell is in the specified table ID; otherwise false.

GetTable.summary: Gets the HTML table element if the supplied element is a table cell.
GetTable.returns: The table element if applicable, otherwise null.

GetTableRow.summary: Gets the table row element if the supplied element is a table cell.
GetTableRow.returns: The table row element if applicable, otherwise null.

CellText.summary: Gets cell text by property name or heading text.
CellText.param: The optional rowIndex. Uses the current row index if not supplied.

ColumnIndex.summary: Gets the column index by property name or heading text.

HeadingIndex.summary: Gets the column index by the heading text.

SetColumnWidth.summary: Sets the row[0] cell width by the column index value.

SetColumnWidthByName.summary: Sets the row[0] cell width by property name.

HasColumnIndex.summary: Checks if the column index exists.
HasColumnIndex.returns: true if the column exists; otherwise false.

GetRow.summary: Gets table row element by index.

RowMatch.summary: Gets the row where the mathing cell has the search text.

SelectColumnRow.summary: Clears background for previous row and Highlights the current row. if the supplied element is a table cell.

SelectRow.summary: Clears background for previous row and Highlights the current row.

UniqueRowIndex.summary: Gets the row index by unique key values.

UpdateUniqueRow.summary: Updates the row for data object unique keys.
